author: trent_vanepps
content: the intent is that early contributions will still be valid, so i'd say #1

author: chiali
content: yes, please üëÜ

author: bridge-bot
content: <kevaundray> > <kevaundray>  In #1 I interpret it as, the ceremony would be ongoing even after devcon with the mvp, so it doesn't stop until the public version is done (re @kzg_ceremony_bot: <Trent Van Epps> [reply]: the intent is that early contributions will still be valid, so i'd say #1)

author: bridge-bot
content:
<kevaundray> Whereas I was under the impression that we wanted also to demo the ceremony ending and then contributors being able to verify that their contribution was included.

The previous contributions can then be preserved by restarting from where the MVP left off in a few months

author: bridge-bot
content:
<kevaundray> You could still verify that your contribution was included in the most updated transcript and have the ceremony continue at dev con. 

Though we may want to advise people to not do this when the real ceremony starts or just not expose that endpoint in the public version, as we want to emphasise that you should verify that your contribution is included in the final transcript that everyone agrees to use, ie its a two step process

author: bridge-bot
content: <CarlBeek> no, there is no intention to demo the ceremony ending at devcon. imo it‚Äôs not worth the dev time and community confusion of ending something that we will be continuing anyway.

author: bridge-bot
content: <CarlBeek> i do want to extract an intermediate output transcript for client teams to have for testing, but i don‚Äôt want to give the impression that anything  is final

author: bridge-bot
content: <CarlBeek> i‚Äôve already had several people reach out to me worried that they missed the contribution or some kind of sign up process. there is lots of confusion out there already

author: bridge-bot
content: <trent_vanepps> > <trent_vanepps>  same - other than having a mailing list, we can just tell people to keep an eye out, it will be very public for a few months (re @CarlBeek: i‚Äôve already had several people reach out to me worried that they missed the contribution or some kind of sign up process. there is lots of confusion out there already)

author: bridge-bot
content: <kevaundray> > <kevaundray>  This is a fair point, re confusion. Its still beneficial to show the act of the verifying your contribution in the demo, though as mentioned above, this may also lead to confusion since in the public version, you verify once the ceremony has completed (re @CarlBeek: no, there is no intention to demo the ceremony ending at devcon. imo it‚Äôs not worth the dev time and community confusion of ending something that we will be continuing anyway.)

author: bridge-bot
content: <CarlBeek> i don‚Äôt want this to be a demo, i‚Äôd like to make it the start of the actual ceremony

author: bridge-bot
content: <trent_vanepps> > <trent_vanepps>  right, that was my assumption as well. the only "demo" characteristics is that it's gated. but the gated output should be folded into the public portion (re @CarlBeek: i don‚Äôt want this to be a demo, i‚Äôd like to make it the start of the actual ceremony)

author: bridge-bot
content: <trent_vanepps> we could point people towards the protocol support google group? i think there's a good reason to announce there - that way we can have people sign up in advance

author: bridge-bot
content: <kevaundray> > <kevaundray>  Ah okay, I was under the wrong assumption. Then the UI will not need to show verification if its just to showcase the start of the ceremony (re @trent_vanepps: right, that was my assumption as well. the only "demo" characteristics is that it's gated. but the gated output should be folded into the public portion)

author: bridge-bot
content: <CarlBeek> it‚Äôs mostly about drawing attention to the ceremony itself and how ‚Äúeasy‚Äù it is to participate
